alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 10:41AM CDT until May 25 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin and Minnesota... Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 affecting Dakota, Washington, Pierce and Goodhue Counties. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Sherburne, Stearns and Wright Counties. Rum River near St. Francis affecting Anoka County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 701.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 702.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.5 feet on 03/24/1985. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
